text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) guerrillas attack Turkish border post from Iranian territory again despite Tehran's denials that it sponsors the rebels.
- IMF report expresses disappointment at performance of Turkish economy and predicts three-digit inflation.
- Turkish company BMC produces first Turkish-made truck in $120-millon project.
- Islamist Justice Minister Sevket Kazan to appoint leading secularist prosecutor in Ankara to southern province.
- Turkish businessmen and academics predict the lira will fall to more than 100,000 against the dollar by the year's end, compared to current level of 89,000.
- Around 800 Iraqi Turkmen arrive at border town of Zakho in hope of being allowed to flee into Turkey.
- Iraqi Kurdish leader Massoud Barzani will not take on Turkish Kurd guerrillas based in north Iraq for fear of appearing dictatorial after his recent victory over Iraqi Kurd group.
